quote: The 2024 gravel ride event offered cyclists new 25, 50 and 100 mile routes and a race challenge for the 100 mile riders. All riders were invited to test their skills in the Burner Challenge segment dash for cash on each of the loops.
It's community building, but it's also getting people out together, both in an activity and in supporting commerce.
Every Tuesday at 5:30 p.m., no matter the temperature or season, the Prairie Burners meet at Grinnell's only bike shop, Bikes to You, for weekly gravel bike rides...

What makes a gravel bike is the geometry. It's pretty forgiving, with low, thick tires, and then gearing so you can climb the hills. We think of Iowa as flat, but you leave town, there are some impressive hills.
Iowa has some of the best gravel roads in the world. We've got about 75,000 miles of gravel road in the state, and in our county alone, we've got over 700 miles.

It is chip-timed with competitive options, but riders and runners can get out of it what they desire. This event is about having a good time, making connections and promoting all the good that comes from cycling.
